select1.label: A.1.7 How are you recording the interview?

input.label: A.1.8 The INTRODUCTION will follow next. Make sure you are at the household now.
A.1.9 Record GPS coordinates
input.hint: GPS coordinates can only be collected when outside.

input.label:
A.1.10 INTRODUCTION: Good (morning/ afternoon). My name is [xxx], I am working with the Mogadishu High Frequency Survey Team, a Somali research organization that is conducting a study on the ECONOMIC SITUATION of families in Mogadishu. Your household has been RANDOMLY SELECTED to take part in this study, If you agree to participate, the interview will take just less than an hour. Your PARTICIPATION IS COMPLETELY VOLUNTARY. All information you share with me is COMPLETELY CONFIDENTIAL. This means that there will be no way any information or answers you give me can be associated with your name. I also want to make it clear that there are no right or wrong answers. The survey won’t provide individual benefits to you, but the information will be used to understand socioeconomic factors that influence poverty in Mogadishu. WE DO THIS this by looking at HOUSHEOLD EXPENDITURE and CONSUMPTION on food and non-food items. This information will be used to INFORM DEVELOPMENT POLICIES of local and international organizations to try and improve the lives of people in Mogadishu. To be able to answer these questions accurately, I would like to speak to the Head of the household TOGETHER WITH THEIR PARTNER if possible. If they are not available, then I would like to talk to the man and/or the woman who would know most about what your household usually consumes and purchases. There are NO RISKS to taking part in this study, and your identity will remain ANONYMOUS. You can stop taking part in the survey at any time. Please take as much time as you need to decide if you’d like to participate in this survey. You may ask me any questions about the research project or the survey procedures that you’d like. I will also leave you my phone number in case you have any questions after the interview.
I will use this mobile phone, which contains the questionnaire, to write down the answers you give me (show phone to the respondent). Also, if possible, it would be helpful if another man/woman [someone from the opposite gender] could be present during the interview to make sure the responses represent the whole household.

select1.label: A.1.11 Can I continue the interview?

input.label: If the respondent refused, thank them, leave, and fill in the next (filter) section to explain.
note: The following questions are designed to determine whether the interview will continue or not. If not then you will be notified at the end of this this section.

select1.label: A.2.1 In what type of area is the interview being conducted?

input.label: A.2.2 What is the name of the IDP camp?

select1.label: A.2.3 Has the head of the household lived in Mogadishu for less than one year?

input.label: You are seeing this screen because you are in an IDP camp, and the head of the household has been living in Mogadishu for less than 1 year. Confirm this with the respondent. If confirmed thank the respondent and end the interview by pressing the arrow at the top right of the screen, then press 'go to end' and save the form.

select1.label: A.3.1 Will the interview be conducted with this household today?
A.3.2 If No, please specify why?

input.label: A.4.3 How many households were living on this compound?
B.1 How many people live in the household?
input.hint: The members of the household are people who eat together and live under the same roof, or within the same compound.

input.label: B.2 What is the name of this member?
input.hint: start with household head, then partner, then immediate family, followed by extended family (uncles, aunts, grandparents), followed by guests and tenants.

input.label: B.3 Give a number
input.hint: first member = 1, second member = 2, third member = 3 etc

select1.label: B.4 How many days over the last 7 days has eaten in a shared houshold meal?
B.5 What is the sex of ?
B.6 What is the relationship of to the head of the household?

input.label: B.7 What is the age of ?
input.hint: Put years. First ask respondent to estimate before putting 'dont know' if they are not sure

select1.label: B.7.1 Why was the previous question left blank?
B.8 Does currently attend school?
B.9 In the last 12 months, did conduct any paid or commissioned work?
select1.hint: Make sure you ask for last 12 Months!

select1.label: B.10 In the last 12 months did conduct any unpaid work like (like volunteer work or help in the household)?
B.11 In the last year, did assist in any kind of small (non-farm) business run by this household, even if for one hour?
B.12 In the last 12 months, was an apprentice?
select1.hint: Learning skills of any kind?

select1.label: B.13 In the last 12 months, did raise any livestock, or fish, or work on a farm?
select1.hint: Make sure its not paid labour

select1.label: B.14 What was the main form of income for in the last 12 months?

Unpaid work like volunteering or work at home
Work in non-farm business even for an hour
Farming or hunting or fishing at own account
Support from relatives or family of friends
